It is one of the longest cricket match series in Sri Lanka, having been played for 106 years.[http://sports.dailymirror.lk/2011/03/24/sri-lanka-junior-stars-in-focus-at-lovers-quarrel/ Sri Lanka junior stars in focus at Loversâ Quarrel] The match is also known as the "Lovers' Quarrel" in public and it is played at the [[Galle International Stadium]]. Lovers' Quarrel was begun in 1905, under principals Rev. James Horne Darrel of Richmond and Frank Lee Woodward of Mahinda.[http://www.island.lk/2005/05/06/sports10.html Richmond, Mahinda clash in Centenary year] ==Series summary== Out of the big matches played up to 2011, Mahinda College has won 23 matches while Richmond College has won 21 matches. Richmond College won the inaugural match in 1905 and Mahinda College's first victory was registered in 1908. Mahinda Collegeâs last victory in a big match was recorded in 2008, while Richmond College's last win was recorded 42 years ago, in 1969.[http://thepapare.com/index.php/sports/cricket/189-southern-sri-lanka-awaits-action-at-106th-lovers-quarrel Southern Sri Lanka awaits action at 106th Loverâs Quarrel ] Having broken a 30 year deadlock of draws, Mahindians registered an emphatic 10 wicket win over Richmondites in the 2008 encounter. In 1953, Mahindian Somasiri Ambawatte captured all ten Richmondâs [[wickets]] in an [[innings]] to claim the [[Bowler (cricket)|bowling]] record of the series and in the same match he scored a century to record the finest [[All-rounder|all round]] feat in the history of the big match.[http://sundaytimes.lk/100314/Sports/spt11.html Richmond looks to break Mahinda stranglehold] In 1972, Mahindians piled up the highest score by a team, when they totaled 359 with their top order batsman P.
